snippet: The influence of the Congressional Sportsmen’s Foundation, a private charity that receives support from the firearms industry, helps explain why passing sensible gun-control measures is so difficult.
abstract: Editorial calls attention to Congressional Sportsmen's Foundation, private charity that enjoys considerable tax-deductible support from firearms industry and has very close ties to more than 250 members of Congress; contends charity shows how deeply rooted influence of gun industry is, and why getting sensible gun measures out of Congress is so hard.
lead_paragraph: The influence of the Congressional Sportsmen’s Foundation, a private charity that receives support from the firearms industry, helps explain why passing sensible gun-control measures is so difficult.
